issue.title: The logic for determining test status is incorrect. The condition `i < passed_tests` assumes tests are processed in order and all passing tests come first, but tests can fail individually. This will show incorrect status for tests that actually passed. Consider tracking individual test results in a list or dictionary instead.
issue.body:
The logic for determining test status is incorrect. The condition `i < passed_tests` assumes tests are processed in order and all passing tests come first, but tests can fail individually. This will show incorrect status for tests that actually passed. Consider tracking individual test results in a list or dictionary instead.
```suggestion
    for (test_name, _), result in zip(tests, test_results):
        status = "‚úÖ PASS" if result else "‚ùå FAIL"
```

comment.body:
_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_

**Replace deprecated substr(), and guard relative size against division by zero.**

Also handles very small containers.

```diff
-    const newStamp: StampAnnotationType = {
-      id: `stamp-${Date.now()}-${Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 9)}`,
+    const denom = Math.max(1, Math.min(containerWidth, containerHeight));
+    const newStamp: StampAnnotationType = {
+      id: `stamp-${Date.now()}-${Math.random().toString(36).slice(2, 11)}`,
       pageNumber: $pdfState.currentPage,
       x: constrainedX,
       y: constrainedY,
       stampId: selectedStampId, // Store the stamp ID instead of SVG
       width: defaultSize,
       height: defaultSize,
       size: defaultSize,
       rotation: 0,
       relativeX: constrainedX / containerWidth,
       relativeY: constrainedY / containerHeight,
-      relativeSize: defaultSize / Math.min(containerWidth, containerHeight)
+      relativeSize: defaultSize / denom
     };
```

<!-- suggestion_start -->

<details>
<summary>üìù Committable suggestion</summary>

> ‚ÄºÔ∏è **IMPORTANT**
> Carefully review the code before committing. Ensure that it accurately replaces the highlighted code, contains no missing lines, and has no issues with indentation. Thoroughly test & benchmark the code to ensure it meets the requirements.

```suggestion
		// Guard against very small containers and avoid division by zero
		const denom = Math.max(1, Math.min(containerWidth, containerHeight));
		const newStamp: StampAnnotationType = {
			id: `stamp-${Date.now()}-${Math.random().toString(36).slice(2, 11)}`,
			pageNumber: $pdfState.currentPage,
			x: constrainedX,
			y: constrainedY,
			stampId: selectedStampId, // Store the stamp ID instead of SVG
			width: defaultSize,
			height: defaultSize,
			size: defaultSize,
			rotation: 0,
			relativeX: constrainedX / containerWidth,
			relativeY: constrainedY / containerHeight,
			relativeSize: defaultSize / denom
		};
```

</details>

<!-- suggestion_end -->

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In src/lib/components/StampOverlay.svelte around lines 58 to 71, the code uses
the deprecated substr() and computes relativeSize by dividing by
Math.min(containerWidth, containerHeight) which can be zero or very small;
replace substr(2, 9) with slice(2, 11) or better
Math.random().toString(36).slice(2, 11) and guard the denominator by computing
const minDim = Math.max(1, Math.min(containerWidth || 0, containerHeight || 0))
(or a small epsilon like 1e-3 if you prefer), then compute relativeSize as
defaultSize / minDim and optionally clamp it with Math.min/Math.max to handle
extremely small containers so you never divide by zero or produce huge relative
sizes.
```

</details>

_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_

**Await the pre-export annotation flush.**

Avoid potential race conditions with an async saver.

```diff
-      // Force save all annotations to localStorage before export
-      forceSaveAllAnnotations();
+      // Force save all annotations to localStorage before export
+      await forceSaveAllAnnotations();
```

<!-- suggestion_start -->

<details>
<summary>üìù Committable suggestion</summary>

> ‚ÄºÔ∏è **IMPORTANT**
> Carefully review the code before committing. Ensure that it accurately replaces the highlighted code, contains no missing lines, and has no issues with indentation. Thoroughly test & benchmark the code to ensure it meets the requirements.

```suggestion
      console.log('Starting multi-page PDF export with annotations...');
      
      // Force save all annotations to localStorage before export
      await forceSaveAllAnnotations();
      console.log('‚úÖ All annotations force-saved to localStorage before export');
      
```

</details>

<!-- suggestion_end -->

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In src/routes/pdf/[url]/+page.svelte around lines 645 to 650, the code calls
```

_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_

**Avoid magic numbers for drag constraints; derive from element size**

Using -100 and -20 is brittle and can clip text unpredictably. Measure the rendered element (or maintain its size) to constrain properly.

One pragmatic approach:
- Add data attribute to the display element.
- During drag, query its bounding box and use width/height for constraints.

Diffs:

1) Tag the display element for lookup:
```diff
-  <div
+  <div
+    data-annotation-id={annotation.id}
     class="absolute select-none cursor-pointer hover:bg-blue-50 hover:bg-opacity-50 rounded px-1"
```

2) Use its size for bounds:
```diff
-const newX = Math.max(0, Math.min(canvasWidth - 100, annotationStart.x + deltaX));
-const newY = Math.max(0, Math.min(canvasHeight - 20, annotationStart.y + deltaY));
+const el = document.querySelector(`[data-annotation-id="${draggedAnnotation.id}"]`) as HTMLElement | null;
+const w = el?.offsetWidth ?? 0;
+const h = el?.offsetHeight ?? 0;
+const newX = Math.max(0, Math.min(canvasWidth - w, annotationStart.x + deltaX));
+const newY = Math.max(0, Math.min(canvasHeight - h, annotationStart.y + deltaY));
```

_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_

**Avoid division by zero; clamp defaults; replace deprecated substr().**

- Guard against 0-sized containers (initial mount/resize) to avoid NaN/Infinity in relative fields.
- Clamp default note size to container to prevent overflow on tiny pages.
- `substr()` is deprecated; use `slice()`.


```diff
-    // Create new sticky note
-    const newNote: StickyNoteAnnotation = {
-      id: `sticky-note-${Date.now()}-${Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 9)}`,
-      pageNumber: $pdfState.currentPage,
-      x: constrainedX,
-      y: constrainedY,
-      text: '',
-      fontSize: 14,
-      backgroundColor: $drawingState.noteColor,
-      width: defaultWidth,
-      height: defaultHeight,
-      relativeX: constrainedX / containerWidth,
-      relativeY: constrainedY / containerHeight,
-      relativeWidth: defaultWidth / containerWidth,
-      relativeHeight: defaultHeight / containerHeight,
-    };
+    // Bail if container size isn't ready
+    if (containerWidth <= 0 || containerHeight <= 0) return;
+
+    // Create new sticky note
+    const widthDenom = Math.max(1, containerWidth);
+    const heightDenom = Math.max(1, containerHeight);
+    const newNote: StickyNoteAnnotation = {
+      id: `sticky-note-${Date.now()}-${Math.random().toString(36).slice(2, 11)}`,
+      pageNumber: $pdfState.currentPage,
+      x: constrainedX,
+      y: constrainedY,
+      text: '',
+      fontSize: 14,
+      backgroundColor: $drawingState.noteColor,
+      width: defaultWidth,
+      height: defaultHeight,
+      relativeX: constrainedX / widthDenom,
+      relativeY: constrainedY / heightDenom,
+      relativeWidth: defaultWidth / widthDenom,
+      relativeHeight: defaultHeight / heightDenom,
+    };
```
Additionally clamp defaults earlier:

```diff
-    const defaultWidth = 150;
-    const defaultHeight = 100;
+    const defaultWidth = Math.min(150, Math.max(1, containerWidth));
+    const defaultHeight = Math.min(100, Math.max(1, containerHeight));
```

```
dimensions (if containerWidth or containerHeight are falsy treat as 1 for
division or set relativeX/relativeY/relativeWidth/relativeHeight to 0), clamp
defaultWidth/defaultHeight to not exceed containerWidth/containerHeight before
creating the note (ensure defaults are computed earlier), and replace
```

comment.body:
_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_

**Exported prop should not be const**

Props must be declared with let to be settable by parent components. If this is a future prop, switch to let; if not needed, remove it.

```diff
-export const scale: number = 1; // For future scaling features
+export let scale: number = 1; // For future scaling features
```

<!-- suggestion_start -->

<details>
<summary>üìù Committable suggestion</summary>

> ‚ÄºÔ∏è **IMPORTANT**
> Carefully review the code before committing. Ensure that it accurately replaces the highlighted code, contains no missing lines, and has no issues with indentation. Thoroughly test & benchmark the code to ensure it meets the requirements.

```suggestion
	export let scale: number = 1; // For future scaling features
```

</details>

<!-- suggestion_end -->

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In src/lib/components/ArrowAnnotation.svelte around line 7, the exported prop is
declared as a const which prevents parent components from setting it; change the
declaration to a Svelte prop by using "export let scale: number = 1;" so it is
mutable and settable by parents, or remove the export entirely if the value is
not intended to be a prop.
```

</details>

issue.title: hdf5.py:  test_hdf5_3 and test_hdf5_4 are confusing
issue.body:
### What is the bug?

It appears that test_hdf5_4 is redundant to test_hdf5_3 and the comment for test_hdf5_3 is incorrect?? Both tests use `://TestArray` for the subdataset.

https://github.com/OSGeo/gdal/blob/3382efd94759d8fcdc8520a0667657b9fcd685f0/autotest/gdrivers/hdf5.py#L66C1-L96C54

```python
###############################################################################
# Confirm that single variable files can be accessed directly without
# subdataset stuff.


def test_hdf5_3():

    ds = gdal.Open('HDF5:"data/hdf5/u8be.h5"://TestArray')

    band = ds.GetRasterBand(1)
    cs = band.Checksum()
    assert cs == 135, "did not get expected checksum"
    assert band.GetNoDataValue() is None
    assert band.GetOffset() is None
    assert band.GetScale() is None

    ds = None

    assert not gdaltest.is_file_open("data/hdf5/u8be.h5"), "file still opened."


###############################################################################
# Confirm subdataset access, and checksum.


def test_hdf5_4():

    ds = gdal.Open('HDF5:"data/hdf5/u8be.h5"://TestArray')

    cs = ds.GetRasterBand(1).Checksum()
    assert cs == 135, "did not get expected checksum"
```


### Steps to reproduce the issue

Inspect https://github.com/OSGeo/gdal/blob/3382efd94759d8fcdc8520a0667657b9fcd685f0/autotest/gdrivers/hdf5.py#L71C1-L96C54

### Versions and provenance

Looking back at the original  https://github.com/OSGeo/gdal/commit/6aa3489d2acf06e8c97c68a8801029e36b6d29f8, I'm not sure what happened.

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: Extend compatibility for Zucchetti ZCS HYD6000-ZP1
issue.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem?

I am currently using the ha-solarman integration with a Zucchetti ZCS HYD6000-ZP1 inverter. I've noticed that when using the sofar_g3.yaml configuration (which seems to be the closest available option), not all entities related to the inverter are being detected correctly. This limits the full visibility and control of my solar PV system within Home Assistant.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I would like to request an extension of this integration's compatibility to include the Zucchetti ZCS HYD6000-ZP1 inverter model. The goal is to ensure that all relevant entities are properly exposed in Home Assistant.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I have attempted to use the existing sofar_g3.yaml configuration as it appeared to be the closest match, but as described, it does not provide full coverage for my inverter's data. I have not yet explored deep reverse engineering of the Modbus protocol myself, hoping for a more guided approach or an official integration path.

### How can I contribute?
I am keen to actively contribute to help extend this compatibility. Could you kindly provide guidance on how I can best assist? For example:

- What additional information would be most helpful from my side? (e.g., specific datalogger logs, raw Modbus register dumps if I can obtain them, detailed technical documentation of the Solarman protocol or Modbus registers for the Zucchetti ZCS HYD6000-ZP1 inverter, etc.)
- Is there a preferred methodology for mapping new inverters within this project? (e.g., is there a specific process for identifying Modbus registers, or a template for new inverter configuration files?)
- What is the recommended process for proposing changes or adding new configuration files once I have gathered more data or made progress?

I am available to provide any further details, run specific tests, and to test new implementations or configurations once they are available.
